Title: Neural Logic Vision Language Explainer
Abstract: if we compare how humans reason and how deep models reason humans reason in a symbolic manner with a formal language called logic while most deep models reason in black box. a natural question to ask is ‚äúdo the trained deep models reason similar as humans?‚äù or ‚äúcan we explain the reasoning of deep models in the language of logic?‚äù. in this work we present neurlogx to explain the reasoning process of deep vision language models in the language of logic. given a trained vision language model our method starts by generating reasoning facts through augmenting the input data. we then develop a differentiable inductive logic programming framework to learn interpretable logic rules from the facts. we show our results on various popular vision language models. interestingly we observe that almost all of the tested models can reason logically.
